text: e. ensuring an inclusive-by-design approach, with consideration for the accessibility and safety of all users, giving particular attention improving accessibility of streets for older users and users with disabilities, and consider the safety and comfort in the public realm of women, girls, and gender diverse people, by: i. having well-maintained streets which are free from clutter and meet minimum width requirements (above); ii. ensuring good sight lines and visibility with plenty of well-lit entrances and exits; iii. maximising opportunities for passive surveillance by using ground floor units to create active frontages, where feasible; iv. considering the needs of both daytime and night-time uses; quieter daytime routes that favour access to green spaces and avoid busy roads, and night-time routes that pass by transport hubs and busier pedestrian ways; and
